source.description: Source of the ticket. Eg: Email
source.title: Source

status.description: Status of the ticket. Eg: Pending
status.title: Status

priority.description: Priority of the ticket. Eg: Medium
priority.title: Priority

ticket-type.description: Used to categorize the ticket. To check the possible types a ticket can have, please go to Admin -> Ticket Fields
ticket-type.title: Ticket Type

association-type.description: Used to determine whether a ticket is a parent, child, tracker or related ticket
association-type.title: Association Type

cc-emails.description: Email addresses added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email
cc-emails.title: CC Emails

forward-emails.description: Email addresses added while forwarding a ticket
forward-emails.title: Forward Emails

reply-cc-emails.description: Email addresses added while replying to a ticket
reply-cc-emails.title: Reply CC Emails

responder-id.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. List of agents can be found in Admin -> Agents
responder-id.title: Responder ID

company-id.description: ID of the company to which this ticket belongs
company-id.title: Company ID

group-id.description: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. List of groups can be found in Admin -> Groups
group-id.title: Group ID

product-id.description: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. List of products can be found in Admin -> Multiple Products
product-id.title: Product ID

support-email.description: Support email address. You can find it in Admin -> Email (under channel).
support-email.title: Support Email

to-emails.description: Email addresses to which the ticket was originally sent
to-emails.title: To Emails

spam.description: Set to true if the ticket is marked as spam
spam.title: Spam

due-by.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved. In UTC format.
due-by.title: First Response Due By

is-escalated.description: Set to true if the ticket has been escalated
is-escalated.title: Is Escalated

first-response-due-by.description: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due. In UTC format. You can adjust this by going to Admin -> SLA policy (under Workflows).
first-response-due-by.title: First Response Due By

first-response-escalated.description: Set to true if the ticket has been escalated as the result of first response time being breached
first-response-escalated.title: First Response Escalated

next-response-due-by.description: Timestamp that denotes when the next response is due. In UTC format. You can adjust this by going to Admin -> SLA policy (under Workflows).
next-response-due-by.title: Next Response Due By

next-response-escalated.description: Set to true if the ticket has been escalated as the result of next response time being breached
next-response-escalated.title: Next Response Escalated

created-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket was created. In UTC format.
created-at.title: Created At

updated-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket was last updated. In UTC format.
updated-at.title: Updated At

sentiment-score.description: Freshdesk uses AI to assess the emotional tone and attitude expressed in customer interaction.
sentiment-score.title: Sentiment Score

intial-sentiment-score.description: The initial sentiment score of the ticket
intial-sentiment-score.title: Initial Sentiment Score

custom-fields.description: Custom fields that the ticket have. Custom fields can be created or modified in Admin -> Ticket Fields
custom-fields.title: Custom Fields

email.description: The primary email address of the contact
email.title: Email

company-id.description: ID of the primary company to which the contact belongs
company-id.title: Company ID

unique-external-id.description: Unique external ID of the contact which be assigned by the user(agent)
unique-external-id.title: Unique External ID

view-all-tickets.description: Set to true if the contact can see all the tickets that are associated with the primary company.
view-all-tickets.title: View All Tickets

deleted.description: Set to true if the contact is deleted
deleted.title: Deleted

active.description: Set to true if the contact has been verified
active.title: Active

other-emails.description: List of other email addresses of the contact
other-emails.title: Other Emails

other-companies.description: List of other companies to which the contact belongs
other-companies.title: Other Companies

other-phone-numbers.description: List of other phone numbers of the contact
other-phone-numbers.title: Other Phone Numbers

created-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the contact was created. In UTC format.
created-at.title: Created At

updated-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the contact was last updated. In UTC format.
updated-at.title: Updated At

custom-fields.description: Custom fields that the contact have. Custom fields can be created or modified in Admin -> Customer Fields
custom-fields.title: Custom Fields

health-score.description: The strength of your relationship with the company. To look at all the possible values or create custom values, please go to Admin -> Customer Fields. Default values: "At risk", "Doing okay", "Happy"
health-score.title: Health Score

account-tier.description: Classification based on how much value the company brings to your business. To look at all the possible values or create custom values, please go to Admin -> Customer Fields. Default values: "Basic", "Premium", "Enterprise"
account-tier.title: Account Tier

renewal-date.description: Date when your contract or relationship with the company is due for renewal
renewal-date.title: Renewal Date

industry.description: The industry in which the company operates. To look at all the possible values or create custom values, please go to Admin -> Customer Fields.
industry.title: Industry

created-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the company was created. In UTC format.
created-at.title: Created At

updated-at.description: Timestamp that denotes when the company was last updated. In UTC format.
updated-at.title: Updated At

custom-fields.description: Custom fields that the company have. Custom fields can be created or modified in Admin -> Customer Fields
custom-fields.title: Custom Fields

items.title: Associated Ticket
items.description: The ID of the ticket associated with the current ticket

items.title: CC Email
items.description: One of the email address added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

items.title: Foward Email
items.description: One of the email address added while forwarding a ticket

items.title: Reply CC Email
items.description: One of the email address added while replying to a ticket

items.title: To Email
items.description: One of the email address to which the ticket was originally sent

requester-id.description: ID of the requester. Must be an existing contact. If you fill in this field, you don't need to fill in the email field. Only one of the two fields is required.
requester-id.title: Requester ID

email.description: Email address of the requester. If you fill in the Requester ID above, it will be ignored. Only one of the two fields is required. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.
email.title: Email

parent-id.description: ID of the parent ticket. Need to be filled out if you want to create a child ticket.
parent-id.title: Parent ID

related-ticket-ids.description: List of related ticket IDs. Need to be filled out if you want to create a tracker ticket.
related-ticket-ids.title: Related Ticket IDs

items.title: Other Email
items.description: The other email addresses of the contact

view-all-tickets.description: Set to true if the contact can see all the tickets that are associated with the company.
view-all-tickets.title: View All Tickets

items.title: Other Phone Number
items.description: The other phone number of the contact

other-companies.title: Other Companies
other-companies.description: List of other companies to which the contact belongs. Each company should be in the format of company-id;view-all-tickets(boolean "true"/"false" Example: 123;true

renewal-date.description: Date when your contract or relationship with the company is due for renewal. Enter in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
renewal-date.title: Renewal Date

TASK_GET_ALL.instillShortDescription: Task to get all the IDs of existing contacts, companies, or tickets

object-type.description: Type of object to get IDs for
object-type.title: Object Type
